newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZOG SAYS CHERVIL-6 WELL FLOW RATE JUMPS.
newsitem.headline: NZOG SAYS CHERVIL-6 WELL FLOW RATE JUMPS.

text.p: New Zealand Oil and Gas Ltd said on Wednesday production from the Chervil-6 well in the Carnarvon Basin offshore Western Australia had almost doubled, to 2,148 barrels per day (bpd).
On August 6 the company reported the well had exceeded production expectations with an initial flow rate of 1,270 bpd.
NZOG has a 23 percent interest in the project, with the other stakeholders including Novus Petroleum with 40 percent.
NZOG said the well was now flowing on a 40/64-inch choke, whereas initial flow rates were on a 32/64-inch choke.
It said the well could result in increased oil recovery from the producing Chervil field of one to six million barrels.
